definitions: the air available to aircraft to fly in, especially the part subject to the jurisdiction of a particular country

examples.text: the airliner was refused permission to enter Maltese airspace

shortDefinitions: air subject to a country's jurisdiction

definitions: space available in the atmosphere immediately above the earth

examples.text: temples and mosques fight for airspace with skyscrapers

definitions: the right of a private landowner to the space above his land and any structures on it, which he can use for ordinary purposes such as the erection of signposts or fences

examples.text: the landlord is unable to extend his property without trespass to his tenant's airspace

definitions: space left to be occupied by air for purposes of insulation.
shortDefinitions: space left to be occupied by air for purposes of insulation
